sentences.en: Are you sure the dog has fleas ?
sentences.cn: 你确定那只狗身上有跳蚤吗？

sentences.en: Bah! Let that flea stick on the wall.
sentences.cn: 去它的! 让那跳蚤钉在墙上,别管它.

sentences.en: Collectors of Fifties kitsch should pop over to Brussels for the flea market.
sentences.cn: 50年代庸俗艺术作品的收藏者应该到布鲁塞尔的跳蚤市场去看看。

sentences.en: Don't blame me if you come back with a flea in your ear!
sentences.cn: 你要是碰了钉子回来可别怪我.

sentences.en: He burst into our meeting and got sent away with a flea in his ear.
sentences.cn: 我们正在开会他闯了进来,大家把他轰走了.

sentences.en: He finds material at auctions, antique shops and flea markets.
sentences.cn: 他在拍卖行、古玩店和跳蚤市场中寻宝。

sentences.en: He headed back towards the flea market and was quickly swallowed up in the crowd.
sentences.cn: 他转身朝跳蚤市场走去，很快淹没在人群中。

sentences.en: Hunter has an interest in prowling around a flea market.
sentences.cn: 亨特对逛跳蚤市场很感兴趣.

sentences.en: I'll put a flea in his ear if he bothers me once more.
sentences.cn: 如果他再来打扰的话,我就要对他不客气了.

sentences.en: My friend likes to stroll around the flea market.
sentences.cn: 我的朋友爱逛旧货市场(跳蚤市场 )

sentences.en: My own accidental cut across the knuckles was a flea - bite.
sentences.cn: 我指关节上的意外刀伤根本算不了什么.

sentences.en: she expected to be sent away with a flea in her ear.
sentences.cn: 她猜自己会被狗血淋头地骂走的。

sentences.en: Such inns as there were were generally dirty and flea ridden; the food simply local cheese accompanied were by bread often twelve months old, all washed down with coarse wine.
sentences.cn: 当地的那些小旅馆通常是既肮脏又尽是跳蚤; 食物只不过是本地土产乳酪就着存放了经常12个月的陈面包, 都用粗制的酒送下肚去.

sentences.en: The arena livens up only on Saturdays and Sundays when a flea market is open there.
sentences.cn: 只有在周六周日跳蚤市场开市时，这片场地才会热闹起来。

sentences.en: The only service I can do to my profession is to serve as a flea.
sentences.cn: 我在这个行当里做的就是跳蚤的工作.

sentences.en: The tendency of her fate and fortunes had been to set her flea.
sentences.cn: 她的命运发展的趋向始终是放纵她自由的.

sentences.en: Walter jumps all over the place like a water flea.
sentences.cn: 瓦尔特跳来跳去,活象个水蚤.

words.tran_cn: [昆]跳蚤；低廉的旅馆；生蚤的动物

phrases.tran_cn: 讽刺：令人恼怒的暗示或尖刻的指责
尖锐的批评；严厉的非难

trans.tran_cn: 跳蚤，蚤目的昆虫，生蚤的动物
trans.tran_en: a very small insect without wings that jumps and bites animals and people to eat their blood
